025
026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets;
027
028import java.util.List;
029import java.util.Map;
030import java.util.Optional;
031import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
032import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
033import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
034import javax.lang.model.element.VariableElement;
035import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
036
037import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.BaseConfiguration;
038import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Content;
039import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets.Taglet.UnsupportedTagletOperationException;
040import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.taglets.snippet.StyledText;
041import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.CommentHelper;
042import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.Utils;
043
044import com.sun.source.doctree.DocTree;
045import com.sun.source.doctree.SpecTree;
046import com.sun.source.doctree.IndexTree;
047import com.sun.source.doctree.LinkTree;
048import com.sun.source.doctree.LiteralTree;
049import com.sun.source.doctree.ParamTree;
050import com.sun.source.doctree.ReturnTree;
051import com.sun.source.doctree.SeeTree;
052import com.sun.source.doctree.SnippetTree;
053import com.sun.source.doctree.SystemPropertyTree;
054import com.sun.source.doctree.ThrowsTree;
055
056/**
057 * The interface for the taglet writer.
058 */
059public abstract class TagletWriter {
060
061    /**
062     * True if we only want to write the first sentence.
063     */
064    protected final boolean isFirstSentence;
065
066    protected TagletWriter(boolean isFirstSentence) {
067        this.isFirstSentence = isFirstSentence;
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * Returns an instance of an output object.
072     *
073     * @return an instance of an output object
074     */
075    public abstract Content getOutputInstance();
076
077    /**
078     * Returns the output for a {@code {@code ...}} tag.
079     *
080     * @param element The element that owns the doc comment
081     * @param tag     the tag
082     *
083     * @return the output
084     */
085    protected abstract Content codeTagOutput(Element element, LiteralTree tag);
086
087    /**
088     * Returns the output for a {@code {@index...}} tag.
089     *
090     * @param element The element that owns the doc comment
091     * @param tag     the tag
092     *
093     * @return the output
094     */
095    protected abstract Content indexTagOutput(Element element, IndexTree tag);
096
097    /**
098     * Returns the output for a {@code {@docRoot}} tag.
099     *
100     * @return the output
101     */
102    protected abstract Content getDocRootOutput();
103
104    /**
105     * Returns the output for a {@code @deprecated} tag.
106     *
107     * @param element The element that owns the doc comment
108     *
109     * @return the output
110     */
111    protected abstract Content deprecatedTagOutput(Element element);
112
113    /**
114     * Returns the output for a {@code {@link ...}} or {@code {@linkplain ...}} tag.
115     *
116     * @param element The element that owns the doc comment
117     * @param tag     the tag
118     *
119     * @return the output
120     */
121    protected abstract Content linkTagOutput(Element element, LinkTree tag);
122
123    /**
124     * Returns the output for a {@code {@literal ...}} tag.
125     *
126     * @param element The element that owns the doc comment
127     * @param tag     the tag
128     *
129     * @return the output
130     */
131    protected abstract Content literalTagOutput(Element element,
132            LiteralTree tag);
133
134    /**
135     * Returns the header for the {@code @param} tags.
136     *
137     * @param kind the kind of header that is required
138     *
139     * @return the header
140     */
141    protected abstract Content getParamHeader(ParamTaglet.ParamKind kind);
142
143    /**
144     * Returns the output for a {@code @param} tag.
145     * Note we cannot rely on the name in the tag, because we might be
146     * inheriting the tag.
147     *
148     * @param element   The element that owns the doc comment
149     * @param paramTag  the parameter to document
150     * @param paramName the name of the parameter
151     *
152     * @return the output
153     */
154    protected abstract Content paramTagOutput(Element element,
155            ParamTree paramTag, String paramName);
156
157    /**
158     * Returns the output for a {@code @return} tag.
159     *
160     * @param element   the element that owns the doc comment
161     * @param returnTag the return tag to document
162     * @param inline    whether this should be written as an inline instance or block instance
163     *
164     * @return the output
165     */
166    protected abstract Content returnTagOutput(Element element,
167            ReturnTree returnTag, boolean inline);
168
169    /**
170     * Returns the output for {@code @see} tags.
171     *
172     * @param element The element that owns the doc comment
173     * @param seeTags the list of tags
174     *
175     * @return the output
176     */
177    protected abstract Content seeTagOutput(Element element,
178            List<? extends SeeTree> seeTags);
179
180    /**
181     * Returns the output for a series of simple tags.
182     *
183     * @param element    The element that owns the doc comment
184     * @param simpleTags the list of simple tags
185     * @param header     the header for the series of tags
186     *
187     * @return the output
188     */
189    protected abstract Content simpleBlockTagOutput(Element element,
190            List<? extends DocTree> simpleTags, String header);
191
192    /**
193     * Returns the output for a {@code {@snippet ...}} tag.
194     *
195     * @param element    The element that owns the doc comment
196     * @param snippetTag the snippet tag
197     * @param id         the value of the id attribute, or null if not defined
198     * @param lang       the value of the lang attribute, or null if not defined
199     *
200     * @return the output
201     */
202    protected abstract Content snippetTagOutput(Element element,
203            SnippetTree snippetTag, StyledText text,
204            String id, String lang);
205
206    /**
207     * Returns the output for one or more {@code @spec} tags.
208     *
209     * @param element  the element that owns the doc comment
210     * @param specTags the array of @spec tags.
211     *
212     * @return the output
213     */
214    protected abstract Content specTagOutput(Element element,
215            List<? extends SpecTree> specTags);
216
217    /**
218     * Returns the output for a {@code {@systemProperty...}} tag.
219     *
220     * @param element           the element that owns the doc comment
221     * @param systemPropertyTag the system property tag
222     *
223     * @return the output
224     */
225    protected abstract Content systemPropertyTagOutput(Element element,
226            SystemPropertyTree systemPropertyTag);
227
228    /**
229     * Returns the header for the {@code @throws} tag.
230     *
231     * @return the header for the throws tag
232     */
233    protected abstract Content getThrowsHeader();
234
235    /**
236     * Returns the output for a default {@code @throws} tag.
237     *
238     * @param throwsType the type that is thrown
239     * @param content    the optional content to add as a description
240     *
241     * @return the output
242     */
243    protected abstract Content throwsTagOutput(TypeMirror throwsType,
244            Optional<Content> content);
245
246    /**
247     * Returns the output for a {@code {@value}} tag.
248     *
249     * @param field       the constant field that holds the value tag
250     * @param constantVal the constant value to document
251     * @param includeLink true if we should link the constant text to the
252     *                    constant field itself
253     *
254     * @return the output
255     */
256    protected abstract Content valueTagOutput(VariableElement field,
257            String constantVal, boolean includeLink);
258
259    /**
260     * Returns the output for an invalid tag. The returned content uses special styling to
261     * highlight the problem. Depending on the presence of the {@code detail} string the method
262     * returns a plain text span or an expandable component.
263     *
264     * @param summary the single-line summary message
265     * @param detail the optional detail message which may contain preformatted text
266     * @return the output
267     */
268    protected abstract Content invalidTagOutput(String summary,
269            Optional<String> detail);
270
271    /**
272     * Returns the main type element of the current page or null for pages that don't have one.
273     *
274     * @return the type element of the current page or null.
275     */
276    protected abstract TypeElement getCurrentPageElement();
277
278    /**
279     * Returns the content generated from the block tags for a given element.
280     * The content is generated according to the order of the list of taglets.
281     * The result is a possibly-empty list of the output generated by each
282     * of the given taglets for all of the tags they individually support.
283     *
284     * @param tagletManager the manager that manages the taglets
285     * @param element       the element that we are to write tags for
286     * @param taglets       the taglets for the tags to write
287     *
288     * @return the content
289     */
290    public Content getBlockTagOutput(TagletManager tagletManager,
291            Element element,
292            List<Taglet> taglets) {
293        for (Taglet t : taglets) {
294            if (!t.isBlockTag()) {
295                throw new IllegalArgumentException(t.getName());
296            }
297        }
298
299        Content output = getOutputInstance();
300        Utils utils = configuration().utils;
301        tagletManager.checkTags(element, utils.getBlockTags(element));
302        tagletManager.checkTags(element, utils.getFullBody(element));
303        for (Taglet taglet : taglets) {
304            if (utils.isTypeElement(element) && taglet instanceof ParamTaglet) {
305                // The type parameters and state components are documented in a
306                // special
307                // section away from the tag info, so skip here.
308                continue;
309            }
310
311            if (element.getKind() == ElementKind.MODULE
312                && taglet instanceof BaseTaglet t) {
313                switch (t.getTagKind()) {
314                // @uses and @provides are handled separately, so skip here.
315                // See ModuleWriterImpl.computeModulesData
316                case USES:
317                case PROVIDES:
318                    continue;
319                }
320            }
321
322            if (taglet instanceof DeprecatedTaglet) {
323                // Deprecated information is documented "inline", not in tag
324                // info
325                // section.
326                continue;
327            }
328
329            if (taglet instanceof SimpleTaglet st && !st.enabled) {
330                // taglet has been disabled
331                continue;
332            }
333
334            try {
335                Content tagletOutput
336                    = taglet.getAllBlockTagOutput(element, this);
337                if (tagletOutput != null) {
338                    tagletManager.seenTag(taglet.getName());
339                    output.add(tagletOutput);
340                }
341            } catch (UnsupportedTagletOperationException e) {
342                // malformed taglet:
343                // claims to support block tags (see Taglet.isBlockTag) but does
344                // not provide the
345                // appropriate method, Taglet.getAllBlockTagOutput.
346            }
347        }
348        return output;
349    }
350
351    /**
352     * Returns the content generated from an inline tag in the doc comment for a given element,
353     * or {@code null} if the tag is not supported or does not return any output.
354     *
355     * @param holder        the element associated with the doc comment
356     * @param tagletManager the taglet manager for the current doclet
357     * @param inlineTag     the inline tag to be documented
358     *
359     * @return the content, or {@code null}
360     */
361    public Content getInlineTagOutput(Element holder,
362            TagletManager tagletManager,
363            DocTree inlineTag) {
364
365        Map<String, Taglet> inlineTags = tagletManager.getInlineTaglets();
366        CommentHelper ch = configuration().utils.getCommentHelper(holder);
367        final String inlineTagName = ch.getTagName(inlineTag);
368        Taglet t = inlineTags.get(inlineTagName);
369        if (t == null) {
370            return null;
371        }
372
373        try {
374            Content tagletOutput
375                = t.getInlineTagOutput(holder, inlineTag, this);
376            tagletManager.seenTag(t.getName());
377            return tagletOutput;
378        } catch (UnsupportedTagletOperationException e) {
379            // malformed taglet:
380            // claims to support inline tags (see Taglet.isInlineTag) but does
381            // not provide the
382            // appropriate method, Taglet.getInlineTagOutput.
383            return null;
384        }
385    }
386
387    /**
388     * Converts inline tags and text to content, expanding the
389     * inline tags along the way.  Called wherever text can contain
390     * an inline tag, such as in comments or in free-form text arguments
391     * to block tags.
392     *
393     * @param holderTree the tree that holds the documentation
394     * @param trees      list of {@code DocTree} nodes containing text and inline tags (often alternating)
395     *                   present in the text of interest for this doc
396     *
397     * @return the generated content
398     */
399    public abstract Content commentTagsToOutput(DocTree holderTree,
400            List<? extends DocTree> trees);
401
402    /**
403     * Converts inline tags and text to content, expanding the
404     * inline tags along the way.  Called wherever text can contain
405     * an inline tag, such as in comments or in free-form text arguments
406     * to block tags.
407     *
408     * @param element The element that owns the documentation
409     * @param trees  list of {@code DocTree} nodes containing text and inline tags (often alternating)
410     *               present in the text of interest for this doc
411     *
412     * @return the generated content
413     */
414    public abstract Content commentTagsToOutput(Element element,
415            List<? extends DocTree> trees);
416
417    /**
418     * Converts inline tags and text to content, expanding the
419     * inline tags along the way.  Called wherever text can contain
420     * an inline tag, such as in comments or in free-form text arguments
421     * to non-inline tags.
422     *
423     * @param element         the element where comment resides
424     * @param holder          the tag that holds the documentation
425     * @param trees           array of text tags and inline tags (often alternating)
426     *                        present in the text of interest for this doc
427     * @param isFirstSentence true if this is the first sentence
428     *
429     * @return the generated content
430     */
431    public abstract Content commentTagsToOutput(Element element, DocTree holder,
432            List<? extends DocTree> trees, boolean isFirstSentence);
433
434    /**
435     * Returns an instance of the configuration used for this doclet.
436     *
437     * @return an instance of the configuration used for this doclet
438     */
439    public abstract BaseConfiguration configuration();
440}
